report_title: Premium Steak Restaurants in the US
executive_summary: Figures have been adjusted for inflation and are presented in 2023 currency. The Premium Steak Restaurants industry has fared relatively well most of the past five years, following similarly positive trends in the domestic economy. The industry is characterized by high-end dining establishments, with average customer checks totaling $50.00 or more. As a result, growth in per capita disposable income, consumer confidence and spending and the prevalence of households earning more than $100,000 in annual income has benefited the industry, enabling consumers to opt for premium steak establishments for dining experiences.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Business Clients Frequent Premium Steak Restaurants for Corporate Events
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Premium steak restaurants are popular among corporations for business events, meetings and celebrations, thus making them a key consumer market for the industry. Due to the high number of corporate clients, most industry establishments are located in highly populated metropolitan areas, such as New York City, Miami and Los Angeles.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: High-Income Households Represent the Largest Consumer Segment for Premium Steak Restaurants
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: For smaller businesses, declining profit often impedes the company's ability to reimburse expenses considered frivolous, such as expensive employee meals. Large multinational corporations relying heavily on a sales force often continue such expenditures, as closing specific contracts outweigh one-time costs. In 2020, a decline in corporate profit forced businesses to cut back on discretionary expenses, such as those spent on premium steak restaurants, thus weighing on industry revenue dramatically.

Product offerings for premium steak houses often boast very-high individual product prices in exchange for a perceived level of scarcity and quality. This discrepancy between price and quantity underlines the nature of fine-dining, such as premium steakhouses, that aim to offer high-quality, rare and intricate dishes in exchange for premium prices. This dynamic creates natural discrimination against consumers of low-income status due to affordability, thus explaining the industry's reliance on high-income households.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Demand From Middle- and Lower-Income Households is Sensitive to Income Changes
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Even consumers of comparatively lower-income groups seek steakhouses for celebrations and events, thus contributing to overall industry demand. As income grows and the general population increases spending habits, consumers of all income groups will likely spend money on premium steak restaurants. This dynamic enables industry consumers to penetrate markets in less affluent or urbanized areas.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Red Meat Prices Directly Affect Profitability
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Purchase expenses represent the largest industry expense category, and meat purchases make up the largest subsect of this expense, as premium steak restaurants market the highest quality meat. Large national chains, such as Ruth's Chris, benefit from economies of scale when negotiating contracts due to comparatively larger order sizes than individually owned restaurants.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: A Positive Economic Outlook Benefits the Industry
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As fears of a global economic downturn fade, how consumers prioritize spending habits has become the main focus for the general population. If bullish economic sentiment were to come to fruition, demand for the Premium Steak Restaurants industry would be positively affected, as premium steaks are categorized as a luxury for consumers. Despite growth in income levels slowing, consumers outside of high-income brackets would continue to attend premium steak restaurants as they feel optimistic about the future outlook of the economy.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: As Revenue Continues Growing, the Industry Landscape Will Follow Suit
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As the Premium Steak Restaurants industry will likely grow, the influx of new entrants has required similar growth in the industry's total labor force. However, smaller restaurants that cannot effectively absorb increased purchase expenses may be forced to shut down.

industry_definition: The industry includes chain, franchised and single-location restaurants that provide premium steak to consumers. Customers order and are served by waiters or waitresses while seated, and they pay after eating. These establishments may provide food services in combination with selling alcoholic and other beverages.

negative_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level low - increasing

key_trends: Industry demand is influenced primarily by economic factors that directly affect consumer end markets. Since industry establishments offer high-end dining experiences, corporate clientele and households earning more than $100,000 annually represent the most prominent consumer segments.

Premium steak restaurants are also sought after by consumers of lower socioeconomic levels, as the industry's reputation for quality makes premium steak restaurants popular for celebratory events of all kinds. For households of all income brackets, trends in per capita disposable income, consumer spending and confidence illustrate the degree to which consumers are willing and able to allocate income toward what would be considered frivolous spending.

The Premium Steak Restaurants industry receives no formal assistance from any state or local governments. However, this industry does receive assistance from several industry associations that are both national and localized.

The regulations directly affecting the Premium Steak Restaurants industry include labor regulations and regulation of employee benefits and conditions such as workers' insurance and health insurance coverage by employers. The industry is also subject to varying liquor, wine and beer licensing regulations and Federal Trade Commission (FTC) regulations over the offer and sale of franchises.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Upper-class consumers with high incomes account for the largest portion of revenue for premium steak restaurants due to affordability.
Corporate expense diners are a key customer segment, as premium steakhouses are traditional locations for business entertainment and employee rewards.
Consumers in this lower income bracket have a lower propensity to dine at premium steakhouses due to affordability constraints.
Middle-class households in this income range are more likely to dine at premium steakhouses compared to lower income groups.
Lower-income households generally do not represent a significant customer base for premium steak restaurants due to affordability issues.
Consumers in this income bracket have limited affordability for premium dining experiences at steak restaurants.

products_and_services.product_description: The traditional American steakhouse with steak as the main menu item, along with appetizers, side dishes, and alcoholic beverages designed to complement different cuts of meat.
Restaurants focusing on premium steak and upscale seafood offerings, with popular entree options being Oscar-style filet mignons, filets topped with lump crab meat, and steak and lobster pairings.
Fine-dining churrascarias offering rodizio service, where servers carve various cuts of beef and other meats at diners' tables. Customers are charged a flat fee for endless service.
Steakhouses that might specialize in chicken products, Italian food or other ethnic cuisine variations that are challenging to categorize and represent minor segments of industry revenue.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Upper-class consumers with incomes above $100,000 account for the largest portion of revenue for premium steak restaurants due to affordability.
Corporate-expense diners are a key component of steakhouse sales, as premium steak restaurants have traditionally been locations for entertaining clients and rewarding employees.
Consumers in this income bracket are middle-class households, with those earning over $70,000 being more likely to dine at premium steak restaurants.
Households earning less than $50,000 do not represent a significant customer base for the industry due to lower affordability of premium dining.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast houses most premium steak restaurants, with major metropolitan areas like Atlanta, Miami and New Orleans contributing significantly. Florida remains a hot spot due to its temperate climate attracting tourists and retirees with a higher propensity to dine out.

California in the West is the country's largest state contributor to the industry. The distribution of establishments closely mirrors population, with major cities like San Francisco and Los Angeles attracting higher-income residents.
Restaurants in the Mid-Atlantic benefit from a large number of corporate customers. New York City is home to many recognizable steak restaurants and remains a hub for large corporations.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The FDA's Model Food Code, a best-practice guide to food handling and presentation, applies to this industry and is updated annually. The FDA Nutritional Value applies as well.

This act requires restaurant companies to disclose calorie information on their menus. The FDA has proposed rules to implement this provision that would require restaurants to post the number of calories for most items on menus or menu boards and make more detailed nutrition information available upon request.
A large proportion of industry establishments operate under franchise agreements. Federal and state laws govern franchising, which varies from state to state.

basis_points.basis_description: Low barriers to entry result in the industry being highly fragmented.
However, each restaurant has its own recipe, lowering the degree of competition that they face.
Premium steak restaurants compete with various food alternatives, including home cooking, fast food, fast casual and independent restaurants.
Steak restaurants differentiate themselves by providing premium quality meats with more complex menu items.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Top companies account for less than 30%
concentration_points.concentration_description: The top four largest companies account for less than 30.0% of total revenue.
Although the industry includes large, multinational restaurant management companies, most restaurants operate within a narrow geographic market.
Industry fragmentation is amplified by single, owner-operated establishments not part of national chains or franchises.

top_companies.company_name: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse and Wine Bar

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Purchase Costs Account for the Largest Industry Expense Category
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Key ingredients are sourced from various suppliers, and optimizing supply chains is crucial to avoid waste, as many purchased products, such as meat and vegetables, are subject to spoiling.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: These ingredients are marked-to-market assets, meaning prices are vulnerable to market volatility.
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Over the past five years, the price of red meat, an essential input commodity, experienced some volatility but ultimately increased.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Profitability Has Declined Following Volatility In Critical Costs Such As Wage And Food Expenses
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Industry profit suffered from a sharp decline in revenue in 2020.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: The Industry Relies Heavily On Providing High-Quality Customer Service And Hospitality
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Significant labor input is required in all aspects of the business, including cooking, ordering, serving and clean-up.
Menu prices and industry profitability are affected by labor intensity since the cost increases cannot simply be passed directly onto consumers in the form of higher prices.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The major markets for this industry are highly concentrated, which implies that the market has a focus on key customer segments.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: The Most Popular is the Traditional American Steakhouse
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: This is the traditional steakhouse consumers imagine when seeking to dine at industry establishments.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Steak and Seafood Restaurants Account for a Stable Share of Revenue
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: These restaurants focus on premium steak and up-scale seafood offerings.

volatility_points.volatility_title: INDUSTRY REVENUE VOLATILITY IS VERY HIGH
volatility_points.volatility_description: As affluent households and corporations represent the largest customer markets, these major consumer markets make the industry heavily reliant on the overall state of the domestic economy.

volatility_points.volatility_title: A HIGH LEVEL OF EXTERNAL COMPETITION HAS CONTRIBUTED TO REVENUE VOLATILITY
volatility_points.volatility_description: The industry represents establishments that center menu offerings around steak.

FAQs.question: Does your company partner with local merchants to market your products and services?
How do review sites, such as Yelp and Google Reviews, impact sales?
FAQs.answer: Consumers do not often check online review site for industry restaurants.

FAQs.question: Is your company located in high-traffic areas to increase visibility?
FAQs.answer: High-traffic areas are ideal for convenience.

FAQs.question: Has your company explored acquisition opportunities to expand your market share?
FAQs.answer: Restaurants that are looking to expand into new areas.

FAQs.question: Does your company offer web-based booking to improve consumer accessibility?
FAQs.answer: Some restaurants offer online reservation systems.
